intro: Cephaelis peraltae, commonly known as the Peralta's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in alpine flora.
